metadata.name: Privilege Escalation via Named Pipe Impersonation
metadata.comment: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmd.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('cmd\.exe', 'powershell\.exe')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('echo')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('>')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\.\\pipe\\')))

output.summary: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.

metadata.objective: False positive: Other programs that cause these patterns (please report) Reference: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/privilege-escalation-via-named-pipe-impersonation.html
